attributes.action: withdraw or  amend local housing allowance aimed at the private sector
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
we are asking the Prime Minister to seriously consider removing local housing allowance, which is unfair and will lead to serious financial problems for many, this is aimed solely at the private sector it discriminates as the council and housing association tenants can still claim housing benefit which in many cases will pay rent in full, the rent service a Government body who set the rental allowances calculate from many sources and use the mid range rent this may and in many cases does leave a shortfall in rent payable by the claimant which in itself causes severe hardship, if they can't manage they are expected to move somewhere cheaper.
If the Prime Minister will not remove Local Housing Allowance will he amend to offer special provisions for pensioners and the long termed disabled in offering the same facilities as would be available in housing benefit and council tax benefit that is rent payment in full for those on pension credit, Incapacity and DLA.
